challenges.title: Create a GitHub Account and Join our Chat Rooms
description: http://i.imgur.com/tN8GSal.png
A png file showing the github home page.

Github is a tremendous resource for a data scientist to share resources and code. The first thing we are going to do is to create a GitHub ID. You can then use this Github ID to sign in to the AnalyticsDojo.
//i.imgur.com/NHWgyHa.gif?1
A gif showing you to click the link below to go to GitHub. Fill in the necessary fields and click submit.
Create an account with GitHub. Be sure to use your real email address - GitHub will keep this private.
https://github.com/join
//i.imgur.com/ALN6zPK.gif
A gif showing you how to click the profile image in the upper right hand corner of GitHub. Upload a photo of yourself. Then fill in the remaining form fields and click submit.
Click the pixel art in the upper right hand corner of GitHub, then choose settings. Upload a picture of yourself. A picture of your face works best. This is how others will see you in the chat room.
https://github.com/settings/profile
//i.imgur.com/VdULD3S.gif
A gif on how to star the open source repository for the analytics dojo.

Open Analytics Dojo's open-source repository. This is where our volunteer team collaborates on building Analytics Dojo. You can "star" our repository. "Starring" is the GitHub equivalent of "liking" something.
https://github.com/analyticsdojo/analyticsdojo
//i.imgur.com/BD9oOja.gif

A gif showing you how to click the link on AnalyticsDojo to go to our chat room and click then "sign in with GitHub" button. Then you can click into the text input field and type a message to your fellow campers.

Now that you have a GitHub account, you can join our Gitter chat room by logging in with GitHub. Introduce yourself by saying "Hello world! I'm just getting started with the AnalyticsDojo!" Tell others how you found Analytics Dojo. Also tell us why you want to learn data science.
https://gitter.im/AnalyticsDojo/Analyticsdojo
//i.imgur.com/aMqddAp.gif
A gif showing you how you can click the settings button in the upper right hand corner and modify your notification settings.
You should change your settings so you're only notified if someone mentions you.
//i.imgur.com/T0bGJPe.gif
A gif showing how you can click on a user profile image to initiate a private message with that user.
Please note that all of our chat rooms are visible to the public. If you need to share sensitive information, such as an email address or phone number, do it in a private message.
//i.imgur.com/WvQvNGN.gif
A gif showing how you can click the link below to download a native chat room app for your computer.
You can also download the chat room app to your computer or phone.
https://gitter.im/apps

challenges.title: Configure your Github account.
description: //i.imgur.com/tP2ccTE.gif
A gif showing how you can click your profile image in your upper right hand corner to your code portfolio and connect GitHub.

Check out your code portfolio. Click your picture in your upper right hand corner. To activate your code portfolio, you'll need to link your GitHub account with Analytics Dojo. Your code portfolio shows your progress and how many Brownie Points you have. You can get Brownie Points by completing challenges and by helping other campers in our chat rooms. If you get Brownie Points on several days in a row, you'll get a streak.

challenges.title: Learn What to Do If You Get Stuck
description: //http://imgur.com/hLBZQSP
The text "Data Science is hard."
Data science and analytics is hard and requires a broad array of skills. You will get stuck. Everyone gets stuck. The key is knowing how to get unstuck.
//i.imgur.com/kcCzzpp.png
The text "It takes time to get good at data science."

It takes time to get good at data science. It is possible to develop these skills for a lifetime and there is a constant array of tools and techniques that are evolving as the volume of data is expanding
//i.imgur.com/9jwzzub.png
An image with the text "1. Understand why you are doing something. 2. Read the error message. 3. Google the error message. 4. Consider other methods. 5. Ask for help.

The most frustrating thing is to struggle through a technical issue and at the end find that the effort was unnecessary. Before wrestling a bear of a technology problem, make sure you know why you are doing it.
//i.imgur.com/ZRgXraT.gif
A gif showing us scrolling through our challenge map.

Now you're ready to start learning data science. The "Lessons" will show you the variety of ways of getting started learning data science. We recommend that you complete these from top to bottom, at a sustainable pace. Our open source community is constantly improving our challenges, so don't be surprised if they change or move around.
